title: Oxford
name: Christ Church
price: Admission is expensive at adults £6; seniors, children and students £4.50
content: The college of ''Brideshead Revisited'' fame, Christ Church is an Early Modern period college founded in 1525 by Cardinal Wolsey as "Cardinal College". Noted for associations with Lewis Carroll (''Alice in Wonderland'') and was a location for the filming of the first ''Harry Potter'' film.  The Christ Church Meadows south of the college is a beautiful green space offering nice views of the spires and quiet corners to relax.
